Class
Description
ActionHandler
Handle the answer from the server.
Answer
Represents the interface for server's answers.

Unit test for simple App.
Bag
Represent the black bag with all the shuffled cards inside.
Board
This class represents the game's board.
Board2Players
This is the board for 2 players.
Board3Players
This is the board for 3 players.
Board4Players
This is the board for 4 players.
BookShelf
This class represents the player's bookshelf.
BookShelf1PlayerController
The BookShelf1PlayerController class extends the BookShelfSceneController class and controls the bookshelf scene for a single opponent player.
BookShelf2PlayerController
The BookShelf2PlayerController class extends the BookShelfSceneController class and controls the bookshelf scene for two opponent players.
BookShelf3PlayerController
The BookShelf3PlayerController class extends the BookShelfSceneController class and controls the bookshelf scene for three opponent players.
BookShelfCompleted
 
BookShelfFilledWithTiles
Information message to the client about successfully tiles placing action.
BookShelfSceneController
The BookShelfSceneController class is an abstract class that implements the GUIController interface and provides common functionality for controlling the bookshelf scene.
Card
Abstract class that represent a generic Card type
Cell
This class represents the cell.
CellNotEmptyException
Thrown when a player quit the game while he picked tiles from the board.

Command line interface.
Client
Superclass representing a generic client.

ConnectionOutcome
Information message to the client about the status of connection.
ConnectionTimeoutTask
Run this task if the server can't ping this client.
ConnectionType
Type of connection: SOCKET or RMI.
Const
This class contains constants common for different classes.
Controller
Main controller class.
Coordinate
Generic coordinate which represent a generic tile's position on the board / bookshelf.

CountDownController
The CountDownController class implements the GUIController interface and controls the countdown timer scene.
CreateGameMessage
 
CreationFactory
This class is used to apply the factory pattern.
CSConnection
Represent a generic client-server connection used by the server to manage the clients.
CustomAnswer

Represent card n.2,6.
Direction
Represent a generic direction.
Dispatcher
Receives the action performed by the user from the CLI, and calls the right method to execute it.

Game
The Game class contains the main elements of a game match.
GameAction
Defines the communication game action sent from client to server.
GameHandler
Handles the match, controller and game.

The GameOverController class implements the GUIController interface and controls the game over scene.

GameReplica
Information message to the client about new game status.

The GoalCardSceneController class implements the GUIController interface and controls the goal card scene.
Graph<T>
Graph data structure of generic type T.
GUI
GUI class starts the graphical user interface.
GUIController
GUIController class defines an interface representing a single GUI controller, which is different from phase to phase.
GUIManager
Class GUIManager controls the GUI class.
HowManyPlayersRequest
Request message to client: number of players.
HowManyPlayersResponse
Number of maximum players in the game.
IBoard
Interface needed to implement the factory pattern.
InputValidator
Check if the action performed by the user is actually feasible and, if so, returns the action to the dispatcher.
IRMIClient
Interface used to communicate with the client from the server.
IRMIServer
Interface used to communicate with the server from the client.
ItsYourTurn
Information message to the client.
JoinGameMessage
 
JSONParser

LoadingController
The LoadingController class implements the GUIController interface and controls the loading scene of the game.
MainSceneController
The MainSceneController class is responsible for controlling the main scene of the application.
MaxDiffGroup
Represent card n.5,7.
Message
Defines the communication messages sent from client to server.
ModelView
This class contains details about the current game.
MultiGameSceneController
The MultiGameSceneController class implements the GUIController interface and controls the multiplayer game scene.
MyShelfie
This is the main class, which permits the player to start a new game, or to join an already existing one.
NoNextPlayerException
Thrown when there are no players connected.
NotEmptyColumnException
Thrown when there are not enough free column to place the tiles.
OutOfBoundException
This exception is thrown when a limit of a range is exceeded.

RMIClientHandler
Class that implements all the methods that the client shows to the server (through RMI).
RMICSConnection
Represent RMI connection.
RMIServerHandler
Class that implements all the methods that the server shows to the client (through RMI).
SerializedAnswer
Server's answer to the client, as a serializable type of object.
SerializedMessage
Enclose both communications and actions needed to be sent to the server in a single object, which is as well serializable.

The SetupController class implements the GUIController interface and controls the setup process for connecting to a server.

This class encapsulates player's username information in a communication object, ready to be sent to the server.

Utilities class used to keep most used methods that don't belong to a specific class.
VirtualPlayer
Represent a virtual connected player.
WrongCoordinateException
Thrown when picked tiles have wrong board's coordinates.
WrongTilesException
Thrown when the tiles picked from the player contain BLANK or UNAVAILABLE.
